topic.title: Signing in and out of Mingle

section.title: Introduction
section.p: You must sign in to Mingle before you can work on a project. Your Mingle project administrator (or project manager) will give you the URL from where to access Mingle for your organization.
Please note that your session will expire after four hours. Nor will Mingle require a password reset after a certain period of time.
section.note: Before you can sign in to Mingle, a Mingle administrator must add you as a user. Then, before you can view any projects, a project administrator must add you as a project team member.

section.title: Signing in
section.p: To sign in to Mingle, type your username and password as advised by your Mingle administrator and click the Sign in button.

After signing in, Mingle displays all projects available to you or the overview page of the last visited project. If you can't see the project you want to access, ask your project administrator to grant you access as a team member.
section.hint: After 10 failed login attempts, you will be prevented from making further attempts for some time.

section.title: Signing out
section.p: To sign out of Mingle, click the Sign out link at the top right of the page.
section.hint: Mingle may sign you out automatically after a certain amount of idle time as a security measure.

section.title: If you've forgotten your password?
section.p: On the Mingle Sign in page, click the 'Forgotten your password?' link.
This displays the Recover your password page.

Type your user name and click the Recover password button to send an email to the Mingle administrator(s) who will then reset your password and email you when this has been done. The Mingle administrator details were setup during initial installation. Mingle administrators can manage user details from the Current projects page Manage users link.
